text: The London Transport Board was the organisation responsible for public transport in London, England, United Kingdom, and its environs from 1963-1969. In common with all London transport authorities from 1933 to 2000, the public name and operational brand of the organisation was London Transport. ==Related pages== *Alexander Valentine - Chairman, 1962 to 1965 *Maurice Holmes (barrister) - Chairman, 1965 to 1969 ==References== * * * Category:1963 establishments in England Category:1969 disestablishments in the United Kingdom Category:Transport in London Category:1960s disestablishments in England
title: London Transport Board
